title.value: Mirror Descent Algorithms with Nearly Dimension-Independent Rates for Differentially-Private Stochastic Saddle-Point Problems
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the top of the paper.
title.quote: Mirror Descent Algorithms with Nearly Dimension-Independent Rates for Differentially-Private Stochastic Saddle-Point Problems

extractions.description: This paper proposes differentially-private algorithms based on stochastic mirror descent for solving convex-concave saddle-point problems with nearly dimension-independent convergence rates. These algorithms improve rates for specific problem settings and utilize various extensions of classical lemmas, providing new insights into differential privacy in machine learning.

type.justification: The paper discusses the development of algorithms with theoretical convergence rates and provides mathematical proofs for their effectiveness.
type.quote: We propose (ε, δ)-DP algorithms based on stochastic mirror descent that attain nearly dimension-independent convergence rates for the expected duality gap, a type of guarantee that was known before only for bilinear objectives.

name.justification: The research is geared towards improving algorithmic strategies in machine learning, particularly in the context of differential privacy and stochastic optimization problems.
name.quote: We study the problem of differentially-private (DP) stochastic (convex-concave) saddle-points in the polyhedral setting.

name.justification: The paper focuses on developing differentially-private algorithms.
name.quote: We propose (ε, δ)-DP algorithms based on stochastic mirror descent that attain nearly dimension-independent convergence rates.

name.justification: The algorithms are designed for stochastic saddle-point problems, a subset of stochastic optimization.
name.quote: We study the problem of differentially-private (DP) stochastic (convex-concave) saddle-points in the polyhedral setting.

name.justification: The algorithms are aimed at convex-concave problems, which fall under convex optimization.
name.quote: For convex-concave and first-order-smooth stochastic objectives, our algorithms attain a rate.
